front.title: On the applicability of various MIKEY modes and extensions

abstract.t: Multimedia Internet Keying - MIKEY - is a key management scheme thatcan be used for real-time applications. In particular, it has beendefined focusing on the support of the Secure Real-time TransportProtocol. MIKEY itself defines four key distribution schemes.Moreover, it is defined to allow extensions of the protocol. AsMIKEY becomes more and more accepted, extensions to the base protocolarose, especially in terms of additional key distribution schemes,but also in terms of payload enhancements. This document provides an overview about MIKEY in general as well as the existing extensions in MIKEY, which have been defined or are in the process of definition.
